page.title: 19NEWBOURNE GROWERS LTD.
page.content: At the beginning of 1984, ten out of nearly 40 smallholders on the former Land Settlement Association estate at Newbourne agreed to pool their resources in a formally organised co-operative. Each member has contributed 1,500 pounds as an interest free loan and committed all his salad crop products to the co-op for the next five years. It is hoped that other growers will be persuaded to join them. The holdings of the founder members range from 3 to 10 acres and between them they have nearly 10 acres under glass. The main product is tomatoes including high value cherry tomatoes packed in one-pound punnets and a full range of lettuce backed up by a variety of other salad crops. They are already supplying leading supermarket outlets and local wholesalers.
